field.name: PRI_M0
field.description: Cortex-M0+ bus priority. Present on selected devices.

field.name: PRI_USB
field.description: USB interface priority.

field.name: PRI_DMA
field.description: DMA controller priority.

field.name: CAL
field.description: System tick timer calibration value.

field.name: SKEW
field.description: Initial value for the Systick timer.

field.name: NOREF
field.description: Initial value for the Systick timer.

field.name: IRQM0
field.description: The IRQ number of the interrupt that acts as the Non-Maskable Interrupt (NMI) for the Cortex-M0+, if enabled by NMIENM0. Present on selected devices.

field.name: NMIENM0
field.description: Write a 1 to this bit to enable the Non-Maskable Interrupt (NMI) source selected by IRQM0. Present on selected devices.

field.name: NMIENM4
field.description: Write a 1 to this bit to enable the Non-Maskable Interrupt (NMI) source selected by IRQM4.

field.name: ENABLE
field.description: Enables the asynchronous APB bridge and subsystem.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. Asynchronous APB bridge is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. Asynchronous APB bridge is enabled.

register.name: PIOPORCAP[%s]
register.description: POR captured value of port n

field.name: PIOPORCAP
field.description: State of PIOn_31 through PIOn_0 at power-on reset

register.name: PIORESCAP[%s]
register.description: Reset captured value of port n

field.name: PIORESCAP
field.description: State of PIOn_31 through PIOn_0 for resets other than POR.

field.name: FLASH_RST
field.description: Flash controller reset control. 0 = Clear reset to this function. 1 = Assert reset to this function.

field.name: FMC_RST
field.description: Flash accelerator reset control. Note that the FMC must not be reset while executing from flash, and must be reconfigured after reset. 0 = Clear reset to this function. 1 = Assert reset to this function.

field.name: MUX_RST
field.description: Input mux reset control. 0 = Clear reset to this function. 1 = Assert reset to this function.

field.name: IOCON_RST
field.description: IOCON reset control. 0 = Clear reset to this function. 1 = Assert reset to this function.

field.name: GPIO0_RST
field.description: GPIO0 reset control. 0 = Clear reset to this function. 1 = Assert reset to this function.

field.name: GPIO1_RST
field.description: GPIO1 reset control. 0 = Clear reset to this function. 1 = Assert reset to this function.

field.name: PINT_RST
field.description: Pin interrupt (PINT) reset control. 0 = Clear reset to this function. 1 = Assert reset to this function.

field.name: GINT_RST
field.description: Grouped interrupt (GINT) reset control. 0 = Clear reset to this function. 1 = Assert reset to this function.

field.name: DMA0_RST
field.description: DMA0 reset control. 0 = Clear reset to this function. 1 = Assert reset to this function.

field.name: CRC_RST
field.description: CRC generator reset control. 0 = Clear reset to this function. 1 = Assert reset to this function.

field.name: WWDT_RST
field.description: Watchdog timer reset control. 0 = Clear reset to this function. 1 = Assert reset to this function.

field.name: ADC0_RST
field.description: ADC0 reset control. 0 = Clear reset to this function. 1 = Assert reset to this function.

field.name: MRT0_RST
field.description: Multi-rate timer (MRT0) reset control. 0 = Clear reset to this function. 1 = Assert reset to this function.

field.name: SCT0_RST
field.description: State configurable timer 0 (SCT0) reset control. 0 = Clear reset to this function. 1 = Assert reset to this function.

field.name: UTICK0_RST
field.description: Micro-tick Timer reset control. 0 = Clear reset to this function. 1 = Assert reset to this function.

field.name: FC0_RST
field.description: Flexcomm 0 reset control. 0 = Clear reset to this function. 1 = Assert reset to this function.

field.name: FC1_RST
field.description: Flexcomm 1 reset control. 0 = Clear reset to this function. 1 = Assert reset to this function.

field.name: FC2_RST
field.description: Flexcomm 2 reset control. 0 = Clear reset to this function. 1 = Assert reset to this function.

field.name: FC3_RST
field.description: Flexcomm 3 reset control. 0 = Clear reset to this function. 1 = Assert reset to this function.

field.name: FC4_RST
field.description: Flexcomm 4 reset control. 0 = Clear reset to this function. 1 = Assert reset to this function.

field.name: FC5_RST
field.description: Flexcomm 5 reset control. 0 = Clear reset to this function. 1 = Assert reset to this function.

field.name: FC6_RST
field.description: Flexcomm 6 reset control. 0 = Clear reset to this function. 1 = Assert reset to this function.

field.name: FC7_RST
field.description: Flexcomm 7 reset control. 0 = Clear reset to this function. 1 = Assert reset to this function.

field.name: USB0_RST
field.description: USB0 reset control. 0 = Clear reset to this function. 1 = Assert reset to this function.

field.name: CTIMER0_RST
field.description: CTIMER0 reset control. 0 = Clear reset to this function. 1 = Assert reset to this function.

field.name: CTIMER1_RST
field.description: CTIMER1 reset control. 0 = Clear reset to this function. 1 = Assert reset to this function.

field.name: RST_SET
field.description: Writing ones to this register sets the corresponding bit or bits in the PRESETCTRLn register, if they are implemented. Bits that do not correspond to defined bits in PRESETCTRLn are reserved and only zeroes should be written to them.

field.name: RST_CLR
field.description: Writing ones to this register clears the corresponding bit or bits in the PRESETCTRLn register, if they are implemented. Bits that do not correspond to defined bits in PRESETCTRLn are reserved and only zeroes should be written to them.

field.name: POR
field.description: POR reset status

enumeratedValue.name: POR_DETECTED
enumeratedValue.description: POR detected. Writing a one clears this reset.

field.name: EXTRST
field.description: Status of the external RESET pin. External reset status

enumeratedValue.name: RESET_DETECTED
enumeratedValue.description: Reset detected. Writing a one clears this reset.

field.name: WDT
field.description: Status of the Watchdog reset

enumeratedValue.name: WDT_RESET_DETECTED
enumeratedValue.description: WDT reset detected. Writing a one clears this reset.

field.name: BOD
field.description: Status of the Brown-out detect reset

enumeratedValue.name: BOD_RESET_DETECTED
enumeratedValue.description: BOD reset detected. Writing a one clears this reset.

field.name: SYSRST
field.description: Status of the software system reset

enumeratedValue.name: SYSTEM_RESET_DETECTED
enumeratedValue.description: System reset detected. Writing a one clears this reset.

field.name: ROM
field.description: Enables the clock for the Boot ROM. 0 = Disable; 1 = Enable.

field.name: FLASH
field.description: Enables the clock for the flash controller. 0 = Disable; 1 = Enable. This clock is needed for flash programming, not for flash read.

field.name: FMC
field.description: Enables the clock for the Flash accelerator. 0 = Disable; 1 = Enable. This clock is needed if the flash is being read.

field.name: INPUTMUX
field.description: Enables the clock for the input muxes. 0 = Disable; 1 = Enable.

field.name: IOCON
field.description: Enables the clock for the IOCON block. 0 = Disable; 1 = Enable.

field.name: GPIO0
field.description: Enables the clock for the GPIO0 port registers. 0 = Disable; 1 = Enable.

field.name: GPIO1
field.description: Enables the clock for the GPIO1 port registers. 0 = Disable; 1 = Enable.

field.name: PINT
field.description: Enables the clock for the pin interrupt block.0 = Disable; 1 = Enable.

field.name: GINT
field.description: Enables the clock for the grouped pin interrupt block. 0 = Disable; 1 = Enable.

field.name: DMA0
field.description: Enables the clock for the DMA0 controller. 0 = Disable; 1 = Enable.

field.name: CRC
field.description: Enables the clock for the CRC engine. 0 = Disable; 1 = Enable.

field.name: WWDT
field.description: Enables the clock for the Watchdog Timer. 0 = Disable; 1 = Enable.

field.name: RTC
field.description: Enables the bus clock for the RTC. 0 = Disable; 1 = Enable.

field.name: ADC0
field.description: Enables the clock for the ADC0 register interface. 0 = Disable; 1 = Enable.

field.name: MRT0
field.description: Enables the clock for the Multi-Rate Timer. 0 = Disable; 1 = Enable.

field.name: SCT0
field.description: Enables the clock for SCT0. 0 = Disable; 1 = Enable.

field.name: UTICK0
field.description: Enables the clock for the Micro-tick Timer. 0 = Disable; 1 = Enable.

field.name: FLEXCOMM0
field.description: Enables the clock for Flexcomm 0. 0 = Disable; 1 = Enable.

field.name: FLEXCOMM1
field.description: Enables the clock for Flexcomm 1. 0 = Disable; 1 = Enable.

field.name: FLEXCOMM2
field.description: Enables the clock for Flexcomm 2. 0 = Disable; 1 = Enable.

field.name: FLEXCOMM3
field.description: Enables the clock for Flexcomm 3. 0 = Disable; 1 = Enable.

field.name: FLEXCOMM4
field.description: Enables the clock for Flexcomm 4. 0 = Disable; 1 = Enable.

field.name: FLEXCOMM5
field.description: Enables the clock for Flexcomm 5. 0 = Disable; 1 = Enable.

field.name: FLEXCOMM6
field.description: Enables the clock for Flexcomm 6. 0 = Disable; 1 = Enable.

field.name: FLEXCOMM7
field.description: Enables the clock for Flexcomm 7. 0 = Disable; 1 = Enable.

field.name: USB0
field.description: Enables the clock for the USB0 interface. 0 = Disable; 1 = Enable.

field.name: CTIMER0
field.description: Enables the clock for timer CTIMER0. 0 = Disable; 1 = Enable.

field.name: CTIMER1
field.description: Enables the clock for timer CTIMER1. 0 = Disable; 1 = Enable.

field.name: CLK_SET
field.description: Writing ones to this register sets the corresponding bit or bits in the AHBCLKCTRLn register, if they are implemented. Bits that do not correspond to defined bits in AHBCLKCTRLn are reserved and only zeroes should be written to them.

field.name: CLK_CLR
field.description: Writing ones to this register clears the corresponding bit or bits in the AHBCLKCTRLn register, if they are implemented. Bits that do not correspond to defined bits in AHBCLKCTRLn are reserved and only zeroes should be written to them.

field.name: SEL
field.description: Clock source for main clock source selector A

field.name: SEL
field.description: Clock source for main clock source selector B. Selects the clock source for the main clock.

enumeratedValue.name: MAINCLKSELA
enumeratedValue.description: MAINCLKSELA. Use the clock source selected in MAINCLKSELA register.

field.name: SEL
field.description: CLKOUT clock source selection

enumeratedValue.name: NONE
enumeratedValue.description: None, this may be selected in order to reduce power when no output is needed.

field.name: SEL
field.description: System PLL clock source selection

enumeratedValue.name: NONE
enumeratedValue.description: None, this may be selected in order to reduce power when no output is needed.

field.name: SEL
field.description: ADC clock source selection

enumeratedValue.name: NONE
enumeratedValue.description: None, this may be selected in order to reduce power when no output is needed.

field.name: SEL
field.description: USB device clock source selection

enumeratedValue.name: NONE
enumeratedValue.description: None, this may be selected in order to reduce power when no output is needed.

field.name: SEL
field.description: Flexcomm clock source selection. One per Flexcomm.

enumeratedValue.name: MCLK_INPUT
enumeratedValue.description: MCLK pin input, when selected in IOCON (mclk_in)

enumeratedValue.name: FRG_CLOCK_OUTPUT
enumeratedValue.description: FRG clock, the output of the fractional rate generator (frg_clk)

enumeratedValue.name: NONE
enumeratedValue.description: None, this may be selected in order to reduce power when no output is needed.

field.name: SEL
field.description: MCLK source select. This may be used by Flexcomms that support I2S, and/or by the digital microphone subsystem.

enumeratedValue.name: NONE
enumeratedValue.description: None, this may be selected in order to reduce power when no output is needed.

register.name: FRGCLKSEL
register.description: Fractional Rate Generator clock source select

field.name: SEL
field.description: Fractional Rate Generator clock source select.

enumeratedValue.name: NONE
enumeratedValue.description: None, this may be selected in order to reduce power when no output is needed.

field.name: DIV
field.description: Clock divider value. 0: Divide by 1 up to 255: Divide by 256.

field.name: DIV
field.description: Clock divider value. 0: Divide by 1 up to 255: Divide by 256.

field.name: DIV
field.description: Clock divider value. 0: Divide by 1 up to 255: Divide by 256.

field.name: DIV
field.description: Clock divider value. 0: Divide by 1 up to 255: Divide by 256.

field.name: DIV
field.description: Clock divider value. 0: Divide by 1 up to 255: Divide by 256.

field.name: DIV
field.description: Denominator of the fractional divider. DIV is equal to the programmed value +1. Always set to 0xFF to use with the fractional baud rate generator.

field.name: MULT
field.description: Numerator of the fractional divider. MULT is equal to the programmed value.

field.name: DIV
field.description: Clock divider value. 0: Divide by 1 up to 255: Divide by 256.

field.name: FETCHCFG
field.description: Instruction fetch configuration. This field determines how flash accelerator buffers are used for instruction fetches.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_BUFFER
enumeratedValue.description: Instruction fetches from flash are not buffered. Every fetch request from the CPU results in a read of the flash memory. This setting may use significantly more power than when buffering is enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ONE_BUFFER
enumeratedValue.description: One buffer is used for all instruction fetches.

enumeratedValue.name: ALL_BUFFERS
enumeratedValue.description: All buffers may be used for instruction fetches.

field.name: DATACFG
field.description: Data read configuration. This field determines how flash accelerator buffers are used for data accesses.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_BUFFERED
enumeratedValue.description: Data accesses from flash are not buffered. Every data access from the CPU results in a read of the flash memory.

enumeratedValue.name: ONE_BUFFER
enumeratedValue.description: One buffer is used for all data accesses.

enumeratedValue.name: ALL_BUFFERS
enumeratedValue.description: All buffers may be used for data accesses.

field.name: ACCEL
field.description: Acceleration enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Flash acceleration is disabled. Every flash read (including those fulfilled from a buffer) takes FLASHTIM + 1 system clocks. This allows more determinism at a cost of performance.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Flash acceleration is enabled. Performance is enhanced, dependent on other FLASHCFG settings.

field.name: PREFEN
field.description: Prefetch enable.

enumeratedValue.name: PREFETCH
enumeratedValue.description: If the FETCHCFG field is not 0, the next flash line following the current execution address is automatically prefetched if it is not already buffered.

field.name: PREFOVR
field.description: Prefetch override. This bit only applies when PREFEN = 1 and a buffered instruction is completing for which the next flash line is not already buffered or being prefetched.

enumeratedValue.name: PREFETCH_COMPLETED
enumeratedValue.description: Any previously initiated prefetch will be completed.

enumeratedValue.name: PREFETCH_ABORT
enumeratedValue.description: Any previously initiated prefetch will be aborted, and the next flash line following the current execution address will be prefetched if not already buffered.

field.name: FLASHTIM
field.description: Flash memory access time. The number of system clocks used for flash accesses is equal to FLASHTIM +1.

enumeratedValue.name: N_1_CLOCK_CYCLE
enumeratedValue.description: 1 system clock flash access time (for system clock rates up to 12 MHz).

enumeratedValue.name: N_2_CLOCK_CYCLES
enumeratedValue.description: 2 system clocks flash access time (for system clock rates up to 30 MHz).

enumeratedValue.name: N_3_CLOCK_CYCLES
enumeratedValue.description: 3 system clocks flash access time (for system clock rates up to 60 MHz).

enumeratedValue.name: N_4_CLOCK_CYCLES
enumeratedValue.description: 4 system clocks flash access time (for system clock rates up to 85 MHz).

enumeratedValue.name: N_5_CLOCK_CYCLES
enumeratedValue.description: 5 system clocks flash access time (for system clock rates up to 100 MHz).

field.name: POL_CLK
field.description: USB_NEED_CLK polarity for triggering the USB wake-up interrupt

enumeratedValue.name: FALLING_EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Falling edge of the USB_NEED_CLK triggers the USB wake-up (default).

enumeratedValue.name: RISING_EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Rising edge of the USB_NEED_CLK triggers the USB wake-up.

field.name: NEED_CLKST
field.description: USB_NEED_CLK signal status

field.name: CAPVAL
field.description: Stores the capture result which is used to calculate the frequency of the target clock. This field is read-only.

field.name: PROG
field.description: Set this bit to one to initiate a frequency measurement cycle. Hardware clears this bit when the measurement cycle has completed and there is valid capture data in the CAPVAL field (bits 13:0).

field.name: DIR
field.description: MCLK direction control.

enumeratedValue.name: INPUT
enumeratedValue.description: The MCLK function is an input.

enumeratedValue.name: OUTPUT
enumeratedValue.description: The MCLK function is an output.

field.name: TRIM
field.description: This value is factory trimmed to account for bias and temperature compensation. The value should not be changed by software. Also see the WRTRIM bit description.

field.name: SEL
field.description: Select the fro_hf output frequency. This bit can only be changed by software when the WRTRIM bit = 1. Note that the factory trim values are for the 96 MHz FRO only.

field.name: FREQTRIM
field.description: Frequency trim. Boot code configures this to a device-specific factory trim value for the 48 MHz FRO. If USBCLKADJ = 1, this field is read-only and provides the value resulting from USB rate adjustment. See the USBMODCFG flag regarding reading this field. Application code may adjust this field when USBCLKADJ = 0. A single step of FREQTRIM is roughly equivalent to 0.1% of the selected FRO frequency.

field.name: USBCLKADJ
field.description: USB clock adjust mode.

enumeratedValue.name: AUTO_USB_ADJUST
enumeratedValue.description: Automatic USB rate adjustment mode. If the USB FS device peripheral is enabled and connected to a USB host, it provides clock adjustment information to the FRO based on SOF packets. USB rate adjustment requires a number of cycles to take place. the USBMODCHG bit (see below) indicates when initial adjustment is complete, and when later adjustments are in progress. software must not alter TRIM and FREQTRIM while USBCLKADJ = 1. see USBCLKADJ usage notes below this table.

field.name: USBMODCHG
field.description: USB Mode value Change flag. When 1, indicates that the USB trim is currently being updated (or is still starting up) and software should wait to read FREQTRIM. Update occurs at most once per millisecond.

field.name: HSPDCLK
field.description: High speed clock enable. Allows disabling the highs-speed FRO output if it is not needed.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The high-speed FRO output is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: The selected high-speed FRO output (48 MHz or 96 MHz) is enabled.

field.name: WRTRIM
field.description: Write Trim value. Must be written to 1 to modify the SEL or TRIM fields, during the same write. This bit always reads as 0.

field.name: DIVSEL
field.description: Divider select. Selects the value of the divider that adjusts the output of the oscillator. 0x00 = divide by 2 0x01 = divide by 4 0x02 = divide by 6 up to 0x1E = divide by 62 0x1F = divide by 64

field.name: FREQSEL
field.description: Frequency select. Selects the frequency of the oscillator. 0x00 = invalid setting when watchdog oscillator is running 0x01 = 0.4 MHz 0x02 = 0.6 MHz 0x03 = 0.75 MHz 0x04 = 0.9 MHz 0x05 = 1.0 MHz 0x06 = 1.2 MHz 0x07 = 1.3 MHz 0x08 = 1.4 MHz 0x09 = 1.5 MHz 0x0A = 1.6 MHz 0x0B = 1.7 MHz 0x0C = 1.8 MHz 0x0D = 1.9 MHz 0x0E = 2.0 MHz 0x0F = 2.05 MHz 0x10 = 2.1 MHz 0x11 = 2.2 MHz 0x12 = 2.25 MHz 0x13 = 2.3 MHz 0x14 = 2.4 MHz 0x15 = 2.45 MHz 0x16 = 2.5 MHz 0x17 = 2.6 MHz 0x18 = 2.65 MHz 0x19 = 2.7 MHz 0x1A = 2.8 MHz 0x1B = 2.85 MHz 0x1C = 2.9 MHz 0x1D = 2.95 MHz 0x1E = 3.0 MHz 0x1F = 3.05 MHz

field.name: EN
field.description: RTC 32 kHz clock enable.

field.name: SELR
field.description: Bandwidth select R value

field.name: SELI
field.description: Bandwidth select I value.

field.name: SELP
field.description: Bandwidth select P value

field.name: BYPASS
field.description: PLL bypass control.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Bypass disabled. PLL CCO is sent to the PLL post-dividers.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Bypass enabled. PLL input clock is sent directly to the PLL output (default).

field.name: BYPASSCCODIV2
field.description: Bypass feedback clock divide by 2.

enumeratedValue.name: DIVIDE_BY_2
enumeratedValue.description: Divide by 2. The CCO feedback clock is divided by 2 in addition to the programmed M divide.

enumeratedValue.name: BYPASS
enumeratedValue.description: Bypass. The CCO feedback clock is divided only by the programmed M divide.

field.name: UPLIMOFF
field.description: Disable upper frequency limiter.

field.name: BANDSEL
field.description: PLL filter control. Set this bit to one when the spread spectrum controller is disabled or at low frequencies. For spread spectrum mode: SEL_EXT = 0, BANDSEL = 0, and UPLIMOFF = 1.

enumeratedValue.name: SSCG_CONTROL
enumeratedValue.description: SSCG control. The PLL filter uses the parameters derived from the spread spectrum controller.

enumeratedValue.name: MDEC_CONTROL
enumeratedValue.description: MDEC control. The PLL filter uses the programmable fields SELP, SELR, and SELI in this register to control the filter constants.

field.name: DIRECTI
field.description: PLL0 direct input enable

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The PLL input divider (N divider) output is used to drive the PLL CCO.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The PLL input divider (N divider) is bypassed. the PLL input clock is used directly to drive the PLL CCO input.

field.name: DIRECTO
field.description: PLL0 direct output enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The PLL output divider (P divider) is used to create the PLL output.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The PLL output divider (P divider) is bypassed, the PLL CCO output is used as the PLL output.

field.name: LOCK
field.description: PLL0 lock indicator

field.name: NDEC
field.description: Decoded N-divider coefficient value.

field.name: NREQ
field.description: NDEC reload request. When a 1 is written to this bit, the NDEC value is loaded into the PLL. Must be cleared by software for any subsequent load, or the PLL can be powered down and back up via the PDEN_SYS_PLL bit in the PDRUNCFG register if the NDEC value is changed.

field.name: PDEC
field.description: Decoded P-divider coefficient value.

field.name: PREQ
field.description: PDEC reload request. When a 1 is written to this bit, the PDEC value is loaded into the PLL. Must be cleared by software for any subsequent load, or the PLL can be powered down and back up via the PDEN_SYS_PLL bit in the PDRUNCFG register if the PDEC value is changed.

field.name: MDEC
field.description: Decoded M-divider coefficient value.

field.name: MREQ
field.description: MDEC reload request. When a 1 is written to this bit, the MDEC value is loaded into the PLL. Must be cleared by software for any subsequent load, or the PLL can be powered down and back up via the PDEN_SYS_PLL bit in the PDRUNCFG register if the MDEC value is changed.

field.name: SEL_EXT
field.description: Select spread spectrum mode. Selects the source of the feedback divider value. For normal mode, this must be the value from the MDEC field in this register. For spread spectrum mode: SEL_EXT = 0, BANDSEL = 0, and UPLIMOFF = 1.

field.name: MD
field.description: M- divider value with fraction. MD[18:11]: integer portion of the feedback divider value. MD[10:0]: fractional portion of the feedback divider value. In fractional mode, fcco = (2 - BYPASSCCODIV2) x (MD x 2^-11) x Fref

field.name: MDREQ
field.description: MD reload request. When a 1 is written to this bit, the MD value is loaded into the PLL. This bit is cleared when the load is complete

field.name: MF
field.description: Programmable modulation frequency fm = Fref/Nss with Fref = Fin/N 0b000 => Nss = 512 (fm _ 3.9 - 7.8 kHz) 0b001 => Nss _ 384 (fm _ 5.2 - 10.4 kHz) 0b010 => Nss = 256 (fm _ 7.8 - 15.6 kHz) 0b011 => Nss = 128 (fm _ 15.6 - 31.3 kHz) 0b100 => Nss = 64 (fm _ 32.3 - 64.5 kHz) 0b101 => Nss = 32 (fm _ 62.5- 125 kHz) 0b110 => Nss _ 24 (fm _ 83.3- 166.6 kHz) 0b111 => Nss = 16 (fm _ 125- 250 kHz)

field.name: MR
field.description: Programmable frequency modulation depth. 0 = no spread. _fmodpk-pk = Fref x k/Fcco = k/MDdec 0b000 -> k = 0 (no spread spectrum) 0b001 => k _ 1 0b010 => k _ 1.5 0b011 => k _ 2 0b100 => k _ 3 0b101 => k _ 4 0b110 => k _ 6 0b111 => k _ 8

field.name: MC
field.description: Modulation waveform control. 0 = no compensation. Compensation for low pass filtering of the PLL to get a triangular modulation at the output of the PLL, giving a flat frequency spectrum. 0b00 => no compensation 0b10 => recommended setting 0b11 => max. compensation

field.name: PD
field.description: Spread spectrum power-down.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. Spread spectrum controller is enabled

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. Spread spectrum controller is disabled.

field.name: DITHER
field.description: Select modulation frequency.

enumeratedValue.name: DITHER
enumeratedValue.description: Dither. Randomly dither between two modulation frequencies.

field.name: PD_SLEEP
field.description: See bit descriptions in the PDRUNCFGn register.

field.name: PDEN_FRO
field.description: FRO oscillator. 0 = Powered; 1 = Powered down.

field.name: PDEN_TS
field.description: Temp sensor. 0 = Powered; 1 = Powered down.

field.name: PDEN_BOD_RST
field.description: Brown-out Detect reset. 0 = Powered; 1 = Powered down.

field.name: PDEN_BOD_INTR
field.description: Brown-out Detect interrupt. 0 = Powered; 1 = Powered down.

field.name: PDEN_ADC0
field.description: ADC0. 0 = Powered; 1 = Powered down.

field.name: PDEN_SRAM0
field.description: SRAM0. 0 = Powered; 1 = Powered down.

field.name: PDEN_SRAMX
field.description: SRAMX. 0 = Powered; 1 = Powered down.

field.name: PDEN_ROM
field.description: ROM. 0 = Powered; 1 = Powered down.

field.name: PDEN_VDDA
field.description: Vdda to the ADC, must be enabled for the ADC to work. Also see bit 23. 0 = Powered; 1 = Powered down.

field.name: PDEN_WDT_OSC
field.description: Watchdog oscillator. 0 = Powered; 1 = Powered down.

field.name: PDEN_USB_PHY
field.description: USB pin interface. 0 = Powered; 1 = Powered down.

field.name: PDEN_SYS_PLL
field.description: PLL0. 0 = Powered; 1 = Powered down.

field.name: PDEN_VREFP
field.description: Vrefp to the ADC, must be enabled for the ADC to work. Also see bit 19. 0 = Powered; 1 = Powered down.

field.name: PD_SET
field.description: Writing ones to this register sets the corresponding bit or bits in the PDRUNCFG register, if they are implemented. Bits that do not correspond to defined bits in PDRUNCFG are reserved and only zeroes should be written to them.

field.name: PD_CLR
field.description: Writing ones to this register clears the corresponding bit or bits in the PDRUNCFG register, if they are implemented. Bits that do not correspond to defined bits in PDRUNCFG are reserved and only zeroes should be written to them.

register.name: STARTER0
register.description: Start logic n wake-up enable register

field.name: WDT_BOD
field.description: WWDT and BOD interrupt wake-up. 0 = Wake-up disabled. 1 = Wake-up enabled.

field.name: DMA0
field.description: DMA0 wake-up. 0 = Wake-up disabled. 1 = Wake-up enabled. Typically used in sleep mode only since the peripheral clock must be running for it to function.

field.name: GINT0
field.description: Group interrupt 0 wake-up. 0 = Wake-up disabled. 1 = Wake-up enabled.

field.name: GINT1
field.description: Group interrupt 1 wake-up. 0 = Wake-up disabled. 1 = Wake-up enabled.

field.name: PIN_INT0
field.description: GPIO pin interrupt 0 wake-up. 0 = Wake-up disabled. 1 = Wake-up enabled. Not for pattern match.

field.name: PIN_INT1
field.description: GPIO pin interrupt 1 wake-up. 0 = Wake-up disabled. 1 = Wake-up enabled. Not for pattern match.

field.name: PIN_INT2
field.description: GPIO pin interrupt 2 wake-up. 0 = Wake-up disabled. 1 = Wake-up enabled. Not for pattern match.

field.name: PIN_INT3
field.description: GPIO pin interrupt 3 wake-up. 0 = Wake-up disabled. 1 = Wake-up enabled. Not for pattern match.

field.name: UTICK0
field.description: Micro-tick Timer wake-up. 0 = Wake-up disabled. 1 = Wake-up enabled.

field.name: FLEXCOMM0
field.description: Flexcomm0 peripheral interrupt wake-up. 0 = Wake-up disabled. 1 = Wake-up enabled.

field.name: FLEXCOMM1
field.description: Flexcomm1 peripheral interrupt wake-up. 0 = Wake-up disabled. 1 = Wake-up enabled.

field.name: FLEXCOMM2
field.description: Flexcomm2 peripheral interrupt wake-up. 0 = Wake-up disabled. 1 = Wake-up enabled.

field.name: FLEXCOMM3
field.description: Flexcomm3 peripheral interrupt wake-up. 0 = Wake-up disabled. 1 = Wake-up enabled.

field.name: FLEXCOMM4
field.description: Flexcomm4 peripheral interrupt wake-up. 0 = Wake-up disabled. 1 = Wake-up enabled.

field.name: FLEXCOMM5
field.description: Flexcomm5 peripheral interrupt wake-up. 0 = Wake-up disabled. 1 = Wake-up enabled.

field.name: FLEXCOMM6
field.description: Flexcomm6 peripheral interrupt wake-up. 0 = Wake-up disabled. 1 = Wake-up enabled.

field.name: FLEXCOMM7
field.description: Flexcomm7 peripheral interrupt wake-up. 0 = Wake-up disabled. 1 = Wake-up enabled.

field.name: USB0_NEEDCLK
field.description: USB0 activity interrupt wake-up. 0 = Wake-up disabled. 1 = Wake-up enabled.

field.name: USB0
field.description: USB0 function interrupt wake-up. 0 = Wake-up disabled. 1 = Wake-up enabled.

field.name: RTC
field.description: RTC interrupt alarm and wake-up timer. 0 = Wake-up disabled. 1 = Wake-up enabled.

field.name: START_SET
field.description: Writing ones to this register sets the corresponding bit or bits in the STARTERn register, if they are implemented. Bits that do not correspond to defined bits in STARTERn are reserved and only zeroes should be written to them.

field.name: START_CLR
field.description: Writing ones to this register clears the corresponding bit or bits in the STARTERn register, if they are implemented. Bits that do not correspond to defined bits in STARTERn are reserved and only zeroes should be written to them.

register.name: HWWAKE
register.description: Configures special cases of hardware wake-up

field.name: FORCEWAKE
field.description: Force peripheral clocking to stay on during Deep Sleep and Power-down modes. When 1, clocking to peripherals is prevented from being shut down when the CPU enters Deep Sleep and Power-down modes. This is intended to allow a coprocessor to continue operating while the main CPU(s) are shut down.

field.name: FCWAKE
field.description: Wake for Flexcomms. When 1, any Flexcomm FIFO reaching the level specified by its own TXLVL will cause peripheral clocking to wake up temporarily while the related status is asserted.

field.name: WAKEDMA
field.description: Wake for DMA. When 1, DMA being busy will cause peripheral clocking to remain running until DMA completes. This is generally used in conjunction with bit 1 and/or 2 in order to prevent peripheral clocking from being shut down as soon as the cause of wake-up is cleared, but before DMA has completed its related activity.

field.name: JTAGID
field.description: JTAG ID code.

field.name: PARTID
field.description: Part ID

register.name: DEVICE_ID1
register.description: Boot ROM and die revision register

field.name: REVID
field.description: Revision.

field.name: BODRSTLEV
field.description: BOD reset level

field.name: BODRSTENA
field.description: BOD reset enable

field.name: BODINTLEV
field.description: BOD interrupt level

field.name: BODINTENA
field.description: BOD interrupt enable

field.name: BODRSTSTAT
field.description: BOD reset status. When 1, a BOD reset has occurred. Cleared by writing 1 to this bit.

field.name: BODINTSTAT
field.description: BOD interrupt status. When 1, a BOD interrupt has occurred. Cleared by writing 1 to this bit.

register.name: PIO00
register.description: Digital I/O control for port 0 pins PIO0_0

field.name: FUNC
field.description: Selects pin function.

field.name: MODE
field.description: Selects function mode (on-chip pull-up/pull-down resistor control).

field.name: INVERT
field.description: Input polarity.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. Input function is not inverted.

field.name: DIGIMODE
field.description: Select Analog/Digital mode.

field.name: FILTEROFF
field.description: Controls input glitch filter.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Filter enabled. Noise pulses below approximately 10 ns are filtered out.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Filter disabled. No input filtering is done.

field.name: SLEW
field.description: Driver slew rate.

enumeratedValue.name: STANDARD
enumeratedValue.description: Standard mode, output slew rate control is enabled. More outputs can be switched simultaneously.

enumeratedValue.name: FAST
enumeratedValue.description: Fast mode, slew rate control is disabled. Refer to the appropriate specific device data sheet for details.

field.name: OD
field.description: Controls open-drain mode.

enumeratedValue.name: OPEN_DRAIN
enumeratedValue.description: Open-drain. Simulated open-drain output (high drive disabled).

enumeratedValue.description: Filter enabled. Noise pulses below approximately 10 ns are filtered out.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Filter disabled. No input filtering is done.

field.name: SLEW
field.description: Driver slew rate.

enumeratedValue.name: STANDARD
enumeratedValue.description: Standard mode, output slew rate control is enabled. More outputs can be switched simultaneously.

enumeratedValue.name: FAST
enumeratedValue.description: Fast mode, slew rate control is disabled. Refer to the appropriate specific device data sheet for details.

field.name: OD
field.description: Controls open-drain mode.

enumeratedValue.name: OPEN_DRAIN
enumeratedValue.description: Open-drain. Simulated open-drain output (high drive disabled).

register.name: PIO023
register.description: Digital I/O control for port 0 pins PIO0_23

field.name: FUNC
field.description: Selects pin function.

field.name: I2CSLEW
field.description: Controls slew rate of I2C pin.

field.name: INVERT
field.description: Input polarity.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. Input function is not inverted.

field.name: DIGIMODE
field.description: Select Analog/Digital mode.

field.name: FILTEROFF
field.description: Controls input glitch filter.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Filter enabled. Noise pulses below approximately 10 ns are filtered out.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Filter disabled. No input filtering is done.

field.name: I2CDRIVE
field.description: Controls the current sink capability of the pin.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW
enumeratedValue.description: Low drive. Output drive sink is 4 mA. This is sufficient for standard and fast mode I2C.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: High drive. Output drive sink is 20 mA. This is needed for Fast Mode Plus I 2C. Refer to the appropriate specific device data sheet for details.

field.name: I2CFILTER
field.description: Configures I2C features for standard mode, fast mode, and Fast Mode Plus operation.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. I2C 50 ns glitch filter enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. I2C 50 ns glitch filter disabled.

field.description: Controls input glitch filter.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Filter enabled. Noise pulses below approximately 10 ns are filtered out.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Filter disabled. No input filtering is done.

field.name: SLEW
field.description: Driver slew rate.

enumeratedValue.name: STANDARD
enumeratedValue.description: Standard mode, output slew rate control is enabled. More outputs can be switched simultaneously.

enumeratedValue.name: FAST
enumeratedValue.description: Fast mode, slew rate control is disabled. Refer to the appropriate specific device data sheet for details.

field.name: OD
field.description: Controls open-drain mode.

enumeratedValue.name: OPEN_DRAIN
enumeratedValue.description: Open-drain. Simulated open-drain output (high drive disabled).

field.name: INT
field.description: Group interrupt status. This bit is cleared by writing a one to it. Writing zero has no effect.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_REQUEST
enumeratedValue.description: No request. No interrupt request is pending.

enumeratedValue.name: REQUEST_ACTIVE
enumeratedValue.description: Request active. Interrupt request is active.

field.name: COMB
field.description: Combine enabled inputs for group interrupt

enumeratedValue.name: OR
enumeratedValue.description: Or. OR functionality: A grouped interrupt is generated when any one of the enabled inputs is active (based on its programmed polarity).

enumeratedValue.name: AND
enumeratedValue.description: And. AND functionality: An interrupt is generated when all enabled bits are active (based on their programmed polarity).

field.name: TRIG
field.description: Group interrupt trigger

register.name: PORT_POL[%s]
register.description: GPIO grouped interrupt port 0 polarity register

field.name: POL
field.description: Configure pin polarity of port m pins for group interrupt. Bit n corresponds to pin PIOm_n of port m. 0 = the pin is active LOW. If the level on this pin is LOW, the pin contributes to the group interrupt. 1 = the pin is active HIGH. If the level on this pin is HIGH, the pin contributes to the group interrupt.

register.name: PORT_ENA[%s]
register.description: GPIO grouped interrupt port 0 enable register

field.name: ENA
field.description: Enable port 0 pin for group interrupt. Bit n corresponds to pin Pm_n of port m. 0 = the port 0 pin is disabled and does not contribute to the grouped interrupt. 1 = the port 0 pin is enabled and contributes to the grouped interrupt.

peripheral.name: PINT
peripheral.description: LPC51u68 Pin interrupt and pattern match (PINT)

field.name: PMODE
field.description: Selects the interrupt mode for each pin interrupt. Bit n configures the pin interrupt selected in PINTSELn. 0 = Edge sensitive 1 = Level sensitive

register.name: IENR
register.description: Pin interrupt level or rising edge interrupt enable register

field.name: ENRL
field.description: Enables the rising edge or level interrupt for each pin interrupt. Bit n configures the pin interrupt selected in PINTSELn. 0 = Disable rising edge or level interrupt. 1 = Enable rising edge or level interrupt.

register.name: SIENR
register.description: Pin interrupt level or rising edge interrupt set register

field.name: SETENRL
field.description: Ones written to this address set bits in the IENR, thus enabling interrupts. Bit n sets bit n in the IENR register. 0 = No operation. 1 = Enable rising edge or level interrupt.

register.name: CIENR
register.description: Pin interrupt level (rising edge interrupt) clear register

field.name: CENRL
field.description: Ones written to this address clear bits in the IENR, thus disabling the interrupts. Bit n clears bit n in the IENR register. 0 = No operation. 1 = Disable rising edge or level interrupt.

register.name: IENF
register.description: Pin interrupt active level or falling edge interrupt enable register

field.name: ENAF
field.description: Enables the falling edge or configures the active level interrupt for each pin interrupt. Bit n configures the pin interrupt selected in PINTSELn. 0 = Disable falling edge interrupt or set active interrupt level LOW. 1 = Enable falling edge interrupt enabled or set active interrupt level HIGH.

register.name: SIENF
register.description: Pin interrupt active level or falling edge interrupt set register

field.name: SETENAF
field.description: Ones written to this address set bits in the IENF, thus enabling interrupts. Bit n sets bit n in the IENF register. 0 = No operation. 1 = Select HIGH-active interrupt or enable falling edge interrupt.

register.name: CIENF
register.description: Pin interrupt active level or falling edge interrupt clear register

field.name: CENAF
field.description: Ones written to this address clears bits in the IENF, thus disabling interrupts. Bit n clears bit n in the IENF register. 0 = No operation. 1 = LOW-active interrupt selected or falling edge interrupt disabled.

field.name: RDET
field.description: Rising edge detect. Bit n detects the rising edge of the pin selected in PINTSELn. Read 0: No rising edge has been detected on this pin since Reset or the last time a one was written to this bit. Write 0: no operation. Read 1: a rising edge has been detected since Reset or the last time a one was written to this bit. Write 1: clear rising edge detection for this pin.

field.name: FDET
field.description: Falling edge detect. Bit n detects the falling edge of the pin selected in PINTSELn. Read 0: No falling edge has been detected on this pin since Reset or the last time a one was written to this bit. Write 0: no operation. Read 1: a falling edge has been detected since Reset or the last time a one was written to this bit. Write 1: clear falling edge detection for this pin.

field.name: PSTAT
field.description: Pin interrupt status. Bit n returns the status, clears the edge interrupt, or inverts the active level of the pin selected in PINTSELn. Read 0: interrupt is not being requested for this interrupt pin. Write 0: no operation. Read 1: interrupt is being requested for this interrupt pin. Write 1 (edge-sensitive): clear rising- and falling-edge detection for this pin. Write 1 (level-sensitive): switch the active level for this pin (in the IENF register).

field.name: SEL_PMATCH
field.description: Specifies whether the 8 pin interrupts are controlled by the pin interrupt function or by the pattern match function.

enumeratedValue.name: PIN_INTERRUPT
enumeratedValue.description: Pin interrupt. Interrupts are driven in response to the standard pin interrupt function.

enumeratedValue.name: PATTERN_MATCH
enumeratedValue.description: Pattern match. Interrupts are driven in response to pattern matches.

field.name: ENA_RXEV
field.description: Enables the RXEV output to the CPU and/or to a GPIO output when the specified boolean expression evaluates to true.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. RXEV output to the CPU is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. RXEV output to the CPU is enabled.

field.name: PMAT
field.description: This field displays the current state of pattern matches. A 1 in any bit of this field indicates that the corresponding product term is matched by the current state of the appropriate inputs.

register.name: PMSRC
register.description: Pattern match interrupt bit-slice source register

register.name: PMCFG
register.description: Pattern match interrupt bit slice configuration register

field.name: PROD_ENDPTS0
field.description: Determines whether slice 0 is an endpoint.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_EFFECT
enumeratedValue.description: No effect. Slice 0 is not an endpoint.

enumeratedValue.name: ENDPOINT
enumeratedValue.description: endpoint. Slice 0 is the endpoint of a product term (minterm). Pin interrupt 0 in the NVIC is raised if the minterm evaluates as true.

field.name: PROD_ENDPTS1
field.description: Determines whether slice 1 is an endpoint.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_EFFECT
enumeratedValue.description: No effect. Slice 1 is not an endpoint.

enumeratedValue.name: ENDPOINT
enumeratedValue.description: endpoint. Slice 1 is the endpoint of a product term (minterm). Pin interrupt 1 in the NVIC is raised if the minterm evaluates as true.

field.name: PROD_ENDPTS2
field.description: Determines whether slice 2 is an endpoint.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_EFFECT
enumeratedValue.description: No effect. Slice 2 is not an endpoint.

enumeratedValue.name: ENDPOINT
enumeratedValue.description: endpoint. Slice 2 is the endpoint of a product term (minterm). Pin interrupt 2 in the NVIC is raised if the minterm evaluates as true.

field.name: PROD_ENDPTS3
field.description: Determines whether slice 3 is an endpoint.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_EFFECT
enumeratedValue.description: No effect. Slice 3 is not an endpoint.

enumeratedValue.name: ENDPOINT
enumeratedValue.description: endpoint. Slice 3 is the endpoint of a product term (minterm). Pin interrupt 3 in the NVIC is raised if the minterm evaluates as true.

field.name: PROD_ENDPTS4
field.description: Determines whether slice 4 is an endpoint.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_EFFECT
enumeratedValue.description: No effect. Slice 4 is not an endpoint.

enumeratedValue.name: ENDPOINT
enumeratedValue.description: endpoint. Slice 4 is the endpoint of a product term (minterm). Pin interrupt 4 in the NVIC is raised if the minterm evaluates as true.

field.name: PROD_ENDPTS5
field.description: Determines whether slice 5 is an endpoint.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_EFFECT
enumeratedValue.description: No effect. Slice 5 is not an endpoint.

enumeratedValue.name: ENDPOINT
enumeratedValue.description: endpoint. Slice 5 is the endpoint of a product term (minterm). Pin interrupt 5 in the NVIC is raised if the minterm evaluates as true.

field.name: PROD_ENDPTS6
field.description: Determines whether slice 6 is an endpoint.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_EFFECT
enumeratedValue.description: No effect. Slice 6 is not an endpoint.

enumeratedValue.name: ENDPOINT
enumeratedValue.description: endpoint. Slice 6 is the endpoint of a product term (minterm). Pin interrupt 6 in the NVIC is raised if the minterm evaluates as true.

field.name: CFG0
field.description: Specifies the match contribution condition for bit slice 0.

enumeratedValue.name: CONSTANT_HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: Constant HIGH. This bit slice always contributes to a product term match.

enumeratedValue.name: STICKY_RISING_EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Sticky rising edge. Match occurs if a rising edge on the specified input has occurred since the last time the edge detection for this bit slice was cleared. This bit is only cleared when the PMCFG or the PMSRC registers are written to.

enumeratedValue.name: STICKY_FALLING_EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Sticky falling edge. Match occurs if a falling edge on the specified input has occurred since the last time the edge detection for this bit slice was cleared. This bit is only cleared when the PMCFG or the PMSRC registers are written to.

enumeratedValue.name: STICKY_RISING_FALLING_EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Sticky rising or falling edge. Match occurs if either a rising or falling edge on the specified input has occurred since the last time the edge detection for this bit slice was cleared. This bit is only cleared when the PMCFG or the PMSRC registers are written to.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH_LEVEL
enumeratedValue.description: High level. Match (for this bit slice) occurs when there is a high level on the input specified for this bit slice in the PMSRC register.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW_LEVEL
enumeratedValue.description: Low level. Match occurs when there is a low level on the specified input.

enumeratedValue.name: CONSTANT_ZERO
enumeratedValue.description: Constant 0. This bit slice never contributes to a match (should be used to disable any unused bit slices).

enumeratedValue.name: EVENT
enumeratedValue.description: Event. Non-sticky rising or falling edge. Match occurs on an event - i.e. when either a rising or falling edge is first detected on the specified input (this is a non-sticky version of value 0x3) . This bit is cleared after one clock cycle.

field.name: CFG1
field.description: Specifies the match contribution condition for bit slice 1.

enumeratedValue.name: CONSTANT_HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: Constant HIGH. This bit slice always contributes to a product term match.

enumeratedValue.name: STICKY_RISING_EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Sticky rising edge. Match occurs if a rising edge on the specified input has occurred since the last time the edge detection for this bit slice was cleared. This bit is only cleared when the PMCFG or the PMSRC registers are written to.

enumeratedValue.name: STICKY_FALLING_EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Sticky falling edge. Match occurs if a falling edge on the specified input has occurred since the last time the edge detection for this bit slice was cleared. This bit is only cleared when the PMCFG or the PMSRC registers are written to.

enumeratedValue.name: STICKY_RISING_FALLING_EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Sticky rising or falling edge. Match occurs if either a rising or falling edge on the specified input has occurred since the last time the edge detection for this bit slice was cleared. This bit is only cleared when the PMCFG or the PMSRC registers are written to.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH_LEVEL
enumeratedValue.description: High level. Match (for this bit slice) occurs when there is a high level on the input specified for this bit slice in the PMSRC register.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW_LEVEL
enumeratedValue.description: Low level. Match occurs when there is a low level on the specified input.

enumeratedValue.name: CONSTANT_ZERO
enumeratedValue.description: Constant 0. This bit slice never contributes to a match (should be used to disable any unused bit slices).

enumeratedValue.name: EVENT
enumeratedValue.description: Event. Non-sticky rising or falling edge. Match occurs on an event - i.e. when either a rising or falling edge is first detected on the specified input (this is a non-sticky version of value 0x3) . This bit is cleared after one clock cycle.
